abstract_summ: RESULTS: Among the 130 patients, we can see (1) distribution: 14 cases with unilateral lung disease and 116 cases with bilateral disease, the distribution was mainly lobular core (99 cases) and subpleural (102 cases); (2) number: 9 cases with single lesion, 113 cases with multiple lesions, and 8 cases with diffuse distribution; (3) density: 70 cases of pure ground glass opacity (GGO), and 60 cases of GGO with consolidation; (4) accompanying signs: vascular thickening (100 cases), “parallel pleura sign” (98 cases), “paving stone sign” (100 cases), “halo sign” (18 cases), “reversed halo sign” (6 cases), pleural effusion (2 cases), and pneumonocele (2 cases).The CT signs include the “parallel pleura sign,” “paving stone sign,” “halo sign,” and “reversed halo sign.As for the morphology of the lesions, 6 had nodular lesions and 7 had patchy lesions; ground glass opacity with consolidation was observed in 6 children, among whom 3 had halo sign, and there was no typical paving stone sign.All patients had absorbed lesions on follow-up CT images after treatment.Five patients had positive initial CT findings with subtle lesions like ground-glass opacity (GGO) or spot-like mixed consolidation.
title_summ: Coronavirus disease 2019: initial high resolution computed tomography imaging feature analysis: report of seven cases.[Clinical features and chest CT findings of coronavirus disease 2019 in infants and young children].Interpretation of CT signs of 2019 novel coronavirus (COVID-19) pneumoniaChest CT findings and clinical features of coronavirus disease 2019 in children.
title_abstract_phrases: RESULTS: Among the 130 patients, we can see (1) distribution: 14 cases with unilateral lung disease and 116 cases with bilateral disease, the distribution was mainly lobular core (99 cases) and subpleural (102 cases); (2) number: 9 cases with single lesion, 113 cases with multiple lesions, and 8 cases with diffuse distribution; (3) density: 70 cases of pure ground glass opacity (GGO), and 60 cases of GGO with consolidation; (4) accompanying signs: vascular thickening (100 cases), “parallel pleura sign” (98 cases), “paving stone sign” (100 cases), “halo sign” (18 cases), “reversed halo sign” (6 cases), pleural effusion (2 cases), and pneumonocele (2 cases).The CT signs include the “parallel pleura sign,” “paving stone sign,” “halo sign,” and “reversed halo sign.Five patients had positive initial CT findings with subtle lesions like ground-glass opacity (GGO) or spot-like mixed consolidation.All patients had absorbed lesions on follow-up CT images after treatment.Clinical history, laboratory examination, and detailed CT imaging features were analyzed.
